item.source: How to host 2 sources at once

item.title: How to host 2 sources at once
item.dc:creator: @ztr_zac1 ztr zac
item.description:
@ztr_zac1 wrote:

What port are you using for your 317, and then your 508. Then, go into both clients and check that the ports correspond. If they do, then the chances are you haven’t port forwarded the new port. To do this, enter you localhost IP(router ip) into a web browser, and you will be prompted for you internet username and password. Look for the firewall rules section and createa new one with the new port, directing it to your computers local IP. Set the rule and try again. If you need help with this just PM me and I will be glad to help. One way to test if the new port is working is simply to use the local host as the server IP in your client.

Hope this helps.

Read full topic

item.title: How to host 2 sources at once
item.dc:creator: @ztr_zac1 ztr zac
item.description:
@ztr_zac1 wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][quote author=Shorty626 link=topic=453679.msg3323119#msg3323119 date=1282871264]
It does depend on where you live, but I’m saying for those who haven’t started yet its soon to come.
[/quote]The word ‘its’ shows possession to the noun it is replacing.
The proper word would be the contraction, it is.[/quote]

GF Shorty lol

The reason you can’t host 2 servers is that they are both using the same port. On your 317 or 508, change the port number so it differs from the other. You shouldn’t need to set a new no-ip up, so just adjust the port in either your 317 or 508 client so it connects the the corresponding server and it will work.

Read full topic

item.title: How to host 2 sources at once
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

Shorty626:

I’ve graduated school, How about you?

How shouldn’t have been capitalized.

Shorty626:

And check this out

The word “and” shouldn’t start a sentence.

Shorty626:

http://www.google.com/dictionary?langpair=en|en&q=He’s&hl=en&aq=f

The link doesn’t work.

Shorty626:

2

Spell out numbers less than or equal to ten.

Whoops owned again.

Read full topic

item.title: How to host 2 sources at once

item.description:
@Shorty626 wrote:

I’ve graduated school, How about you? All my goal is to fix the rampant stupidity of these forums. Most of this stuff has already been answered yet people seem to retarded to search. And check this out, Mr. English how about number 2 of this definition listing: http://www.google.com/dictionary?langpair=en|en&q=He’s&hl=en&aq=f

Whoops owned again.

item.title: How to host 2 sources at once
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][quote author=Shorty626 link=topic=453679.msg3323055#msg3323055 date=1282868885]
And he made the post one hour ago, an Education where do you get one? This is the second time you’ve contradicted yourself in 24 hours.
[/quote]How can you try correcting someone on an education when your grammar is extremely bad.

You cannot start a sentence with the word ‘and.’
Education should not be capitalized as it is neither a proper noun, nor the beginning of the clause.

Also, when posting numerical data, you should spell out the numbers in a text form unless the number is greater than or equal to one hundred, or it is a specific date.

In other words the post he made was the second time he’s contradicted himself. Derp. Maybe you should try school or maybe “You was educated badly” Point proven again.

Again, the grammar is horrendous.

‘He’s contradicted himself.’
He is contradicted himself. - Makes no sense. Point proven.

‘You was educated badly’

You seriously should try school yourself, my friend.[/quote]
High five!

  • Gives I Vain I a high five

Read full topic
